forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Partly cloudy. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. Northeast wind 9 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Northeast wind 9 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, a soft haze clings to the air, hinting at the coming rain. Tonight's forecast whispers of light showers, brushing against the city with a gentle promise of moisture. The temperature lingers around a cool 44 degrees, gradually nudging up to a mild 46 overnight, all the while a northeast wind dances through the streets at a brisk pace, stirring a sense of anticipation in the atmosphere. 

Looking ahead to Sunday, there is a tentative hope for blue skies as the day unfolds, yet don’t grow too comfortable—shower possibilities remain until the afternoon. As the sun rises, it might illuminate the city in splashes of errant light, elevating spirits with a high near 56, before tapering off as the day progresses. The northeast winds may pick up, creating a fresh, almost invigorating feel as they gust through at up to 24 mph. For those venturing out, layered clothing accompanied by an umbrella would serve well against the unpredictable charm of December’s whims. While the marine layer may obscure some views, the promise of sunshine invites strolls along less crowded streets or perhaps settling into a cozy nook at a local café, watching the world outside shift with the weather.
